Function Documentation

PIZFactorOracle* pizFactorOracleNew ( long  argc,
long *  argv 
)

Create the factor oracle.

The function currently do not need arguments (provided for later improvements). In case of failure the pointer is NULL.

Parameters:
argc 0.
argv NULL.
Returns:
A pointer to the new factor oracle.
Remarks:
The following shows how to create a factor oracle. 
 PIZFactorOracle *oracle = pizFactorOracleNew (0, NULL);

void pizFactorOracleFree ( PIZFactorOracle *  x  ) 

Free the factor oracle.

It is safe to pass NULL pointer.

Parameters:
x A Pointer.

PIZError pizFactorOracleAdd ( PIZFactorOracle *  x,
long  argc,
long *  argv 
)

Add values to the factor oracle.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
argc The number of values.
argv A pointer to the values.
Returns:
An error code.
Remarks:
The number of allocated nodes is doubled in case of exceeding.

void pizFactorOracleClear ( PIZFactorOracle *  x  ) 

Clear the factor oracle.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.

PIZError pizFactorOracleProceed ( PIZFactorOracle *  x,
long  argc,
long *  argv 
)

Fill a given array with factor oracle values.

Each step a number between 0. and 1. is randomly drawn : if it is inferior to the straightRatio the playback head go straight, otherwise, there is half chance to go backward (if backward threshold is reached), and half chance to go forward (if arcs exist).

Parameters:
argc Number of step to proceed.
argv Pointer to the long array to fill.
Returns:
An error code.

long pizFactorOracleCount ( const PIZFactorOracle *  x  ) 

Get the number of nodes in the factor oracle.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
The number of nodes.

void pizFactorOracleSetBackwardThreshold ( PIZFactorOracle *  x,
long  n 
)

Set the backward threshold of the factor oracle.

This is the minimum size of repeated sequence required to go backward. Default value is 2.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
n The backward threshold.
Returns:
The number of nodes.

void pizFactorOracleSetStraightRatio ( PIZFactorOracle *  x,
double  f 
)

Set the straight ratio of the factor oracle.

This is the chance to the playback head to go straight for each step in the automaton. Minimum is 0., maximum is 1., default value is 0.25.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
n The straight ratio.

long pizFactorOracleBackwardThreshold ( const PIZFactorOracle *  x  ) 

Get the backward threshold of the factor oracle.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
The backward threshold.

double pizFactorOracleStraightRatio ( const PIZFactorOracle *  x  ) 

Get the straight ratio of the factor oracle.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
The straight ratio.

PIZError pizFactorOracleEncodeNodeToArray ( const PIZFactorOracle *  x,
long  node,
PIZGrowingArray *  a 
)

Encode a node to a dynamic array.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
node The index of the node to get.
a A pointer to a dynamic array.
Returns:
An error code.
Remarks:
An example : 
 long             err = PIZ_GOOD;
 PIZGrowingArray  *a = pizGrowingArrayNew (16);

 err = pizFactorOracleEncodeNodeToArray (x->factorOracle, node, a);

 if (!err)
      {
          long i, k, ref, lrs;
           
          ref = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_ENCODE_REFER);
          lrs = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_ENCODE_LRS);
          k   = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_ENCODE_ARCS);

          for (i = 0; i < k; i++) 
              {
                  long destination, value;

                  destination = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_ENCODE_ARCS + 1 + i);
                  value       = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_ENCODE_ARCS + 1 + i + k);
              }
      }
   
 pizGrowingArrayFree (a);
